title: Measuring the Ocean
caption: The Ocean Observatories Initiative (OOI) has hundreds of instruments collecting data every minute of every day from locations (arrays) throughout the Pacific and Atlantic Oceans. Here we are looking at data from the Coastal Pioneer Array (red box).

title: TEMP TITLE 2
caption: The Coastal Pioneer location (blue boxes) is in the ocean off of Rhode Island and Massachusetts. There are many instruments at this location. Data in this activity were collected from the Inshore and Central Surface Moorings.

title: TEMP TITLE 3
caption: The Surface Buoy (red box) contains the instruments used to collect these data on each mooring (instruments attached to a cable in the water). Data for this activity were collected using bulk meteorology and surface wave spectra instruments.

title: Surface Mooring
caption: Wave height is the distance between the highest point (the crest) and the lowest point (the trough) of a single wave. Wave period is the amount of time that elapses between two successive waves
